means: （尤指女人或其行为）轻浮的，朝三暮四的，反复无常的

sentence.Network_en: He said I was too flighty to be a good supervisor.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说我太轻浮不能成为一名好的管理员.

sentence.Network_en: She is too flighty to take care of young children.
sentence.Network_cn: 她太不负责任,不能照顾小孩.

sentence.Network_en: Isabelle was a frivolous little fool, vain and flighty.
sentence.Network_cn: 伊莎贝尔是一个轻佻的小傻瓜，自负而又反复无常。

list.abs: these flighty voters , referred to as yawarakai hoshu-so , or " flexible conservatives " , are the king makers of Japanese politics .这些中间选民被称为“灵活的保守派”，他们是决定日本政治走势的主要力量。
and almost all the debt-holders are Japanese , not flighty foreigners .并且几乎所有的债券持有人都是日本人，而非反复无常的外国人。
flightily 轻浮地flightiness 轻浮flightism 逃跑主义
she a frivolous little fool flighty .她是个单纯轻浮的小傻女孩儿。

means.word_mean: 反复无常的,神经微有错乱的

entry.tran: 轻浮的;见异思迁的;反复无常的
entry.def: If you say that someone is flighty, you disapprove of them because they are not very serious or reliable and keep changing from one activity, idea, or partner to another.

example.ex: Isabelle was a frivolous little fool, vain and flighty.
example.tran: 伊莎贝尔是个轻佻、没头脑的小女人，非常虚荣又反复无常。
